Spotlight Clayton
Clayton is Turning 150 Years Old!
The Town of Clayton is turning 150 years old this year! So we’re throwing a BIG birthday party and you’re invited! Join us in Downtown Clayton on Saturday, April 13th for the kick-off of Clayton’s Sesquicentennial Year of Celebration. They’ll be free cake, ice cream, popcorn, face-painting, rides and inflatables for the kids – all free! Enjoy two bands, food trucks, circus performers and meet all the civic and non-profit groups doing great things in the community. Want your photo in a permanent billboard-sized mural so future generations can see YOU were part of history? Then you’ll want to be at Town Square Main Street from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Learn more about our year of celebration at Clayton150.org!
Learn More
New Parking Spaces Coming to Second & Fayetteville Streets
Expect minor traffic delays around Town Hall/The Clayton Center as crews are beginning the process of paving new parking spaces on Second Street. The work may require Second Street between Fayetteville and Church streets to be temporarily blocked. This project will add 20 additional angled parking spaces at Town Hall/The Clayton Center. Ten new spaces will be added to Fayetteville Street and 10 new spaces on Second Street.
Learn More
Water may smell like chlorine, but is safe to drink
Until early April, residents in and around Clayton may notice a chlorine scent coming from their tap water. This is normal, and it's still perfectly safe to drink. Johnston County is doing an annual treatment, and most people won't notice any change. Click for more info.
Learn More
Loose Leaf Collection Has Ended! Please bag all loose yard waste for weekly pick-up!
Loose leaf collection endsed FRIDAY, February 1st! It was the last day our suction truck was scheduled to come around to collect loose leaves just on the edge of the curb. You can continue to use clear bags, containers or the official All Star Yard Waste rollcart to contanerize your leaves year-round for weekly pick-up. Click the link for details.
Learn More
Check out the New Parks & Recreation Guide!
Ever thought about taking a fitness class? Photography class? How about getting your teenage son into pottery? How cool! It's all in the 2019 Winter/Spring Program and Event Guide from our awesome Parks & Recreation team! Meet our new director, save the dates for all our upcoming events and bookmark our greenway and park maps! It's all in the guide - pick one up at any town facility!
Learn More
2017 Clayton Water Quality Reports Available!
Our Annual Water Quality Reports for 2017 are now available! Click here for the most recent Town of Clayton Water Quality Report, which covers the majority of Town. There's a separate Town of Clayton NORTH Water Quality Report, which covers customers who live in Riverwood Athletic Club area. These reports cover all the testing that we have done from January 1 through December 31, 2017.
Learn More
